bibl.title: Letter from Edgar Mayer to Philip Showalter Hench, June 15, 1943

div1.p: Mayer assures Hench that he wants him on the scientific board of the Finlay Institute. He inquires if Hench would be interested in accompanying a group of military doctors on a training mission to Cuba.

div1.head: Letter from Edgar Mayer to Philip Showalter Hench, June 15, 1943
div1.opener:
DR. EDGAR MAYER
FOUR SEVENTY PARK AVENUE
NEW YORK
June 15, 1943.
---
TELEPHONE PLAZA 3-5468-9
Lt. Col. P. S. Hench
Station Hospital
Camp Carson, Colorado.
Dear Phil:
div1.p:
As you probably know, I have been to Mexico
and therefore your letter of April 28th was not answered
before.

As to your point about being on the scientific
advisory board of the Finlay Institute, I can assure you
that nobody realizes better than I that you are not trying
to force yourself in any way; it is I that want it so and
I will again take it up with our group when we meet next
Monday. Basil O'Connor, Morton Kahn and I are leaving for
Mexico in two weeks to look into their needs and Public
Health problems at the invitation of the President. This
will be under the Finlay. Tom Mackie, now a Colonel at the
Walter Reed School in Tropical Medicine, is planning to go
to Cuba within about four to six weeks when he returns from
his present mission, to take Army and Navy doctors down there
for training in practical aspects of tropical diseases. This
plan is not completely decided upon yet, but I do wish that
it were possible if he does go, that you could accompany him.
I am talking completely off the record when I say this as
I haven't talked to Tom about it, nor have I any knowledge
that it could be arranged while you are in your present
position in the Service at Camp Carson. However, I am not
sure how long I will be in Mexico on this mission, and Tom
may come back in the meantime, so I am dropping him a note
today which he will find on his return (I believe he is in
Europe) suggesting this. If it doesn't meet with your
approval, then you can just toss it aside.
Do let me hear from you in the next ten days.
